<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns a list of playable units in a multiplayer game (occupied by both AI or players), created on the following sides [[east]]/[[opfor]], [[west]]/[[blufor]], [[resistance]]/[[independent]] and [[civilian]] only. Does not contain units of [[sideLogic]].<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>This command returns an empty array in Singleplayer; use [[switchableUnits]] instead.</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important</title><part><name index="1"/><value>This command does not include dead players awaiting for respawn.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[playableUnits]] </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>{ [[_x]] [[groupChat]] "I'm a playable unit."; } [[forEach]] [[playableUnits]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_playableInGroup = [[units]] [[group]] [[player]] [[arrayIntersect]] [[playableUnits]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_nonPlayableInGroup = [[units]] [[group]] [[player]] - [[playableUnits]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[playableSlotsNumber]], [[allPlayers]], [[allCurators]], [[allGroups]], [[allDead]], [[switchableUnits]], [[vehicles]], [[allUnitsUAV]], [[allDeadMen]], [[isPlayer]], [[playersNumber]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value> </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 23, 2014 - 23:13 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DreadedEntity|DreadedEntity]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To get a list of all player-controlled units:
<code>_allPlayers = [];
{
	[[if]] ([[isPlayer]] _x) [[then]]
	{
		_allPlayers [[pushBack]] _x;
	};
} [[forEach]] [[playableUnits]];</code>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 16, 2015 - 10:05 (UTC)
<dt class="note">[[User:FR Starfox64|FR Starfox64]]
<dd class="note">[[playableUnits]] will not return dead players, use [[allPlayers]] instead.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 14, 2017 - 22:05 (UTC)
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]
<dd class="note">Using the Editor (multiplayer attributes) for unchecking "enable AI", or disabling AI(s) in lobby, will make [[playableUnits]] as a public variable,  updated by each JIP on disabled slot.
So, if all slots are disabled AI, playableUnits is same as allPlayers<br>
Furthermore, in this case, non-played slot (playable and disabled AI) units simply don't exist!<br>
i.e. If you name 8 playable units: u1..u8, then 2 players in game: u3 & u6<br>
playableUnits will return [u3,u6], and true for  isNil "u1", isNil "u2"... until another player takes the slot.
</dd>
</dl></root>
